body:
### Problem

On closing a file attached with treesitter and setting foldexpr to treesitter foldexpr, it throws an error

It was working fine before 26cc946226d96bf6b474d850b961e1060346c96f




### Steps to reproduce

Have a repro.lua file with
```lua
vim.o.foldmethod = "expr"
vim.o.foldexpr = "v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()"
```

and a test.c file with the content below
```c
#include <stdio.h>

int main() {
  int x;
}
```

List of commands:
- `nvim --clean -u repro.lua test.c`
- `:lua vim.treesitter.start()`
- `zx`
- `:bd`

### Expected behavior

To not throw the error below: 
```txt
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:121: There is no parser available for buffer 1 and one could not be created be
cause lang could not be determined. Either pass lang or set the buffer filetype                                                                                               
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                                              
        [C]: in function 'error'                                                                                                                                              
        /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:121: in function 'get_parser'                                                                                    
        /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:126: in function 'get_folds_levels'                                                                        
        /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:222: in function </usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:219>
```

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0-dev-241+g26cc94622

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux 6.2.13-zen-1-zen

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.28.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

Build from repo

comment_data.body:
Just got this issue on latest nightly build

```
NVIM v0.10.0-dev-build-20231109-156-g405bad5e0
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1700008891
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

```
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua
:120: There is no parser available for buffer 79 and one could not be created because lang coul
d not be determined. Either pass lang or set the buffer filetype                               
stack traceback:                                                                               
        [C]: in function 'error'                                                               
        /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter.lua:120: in function 'get_parser'     
        /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:166: in function 'get_folds_
levels'                                                                                        
        /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:300: in function 'fn'       
        /usr/local/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:289: in function </usr/local
/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:285> 
```

labels.description: wrong behavior that was introduced in a previous commit (please bisect)
labels.name: bug-regression

labels.description: issue has been tracked to a specific commit
labels.name: has:bisected

title: Treesitter foldexpr throws error on `:bd`
